newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Sep 30.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Sep 30.

text.p: * Microsoft Corp warned late Friday that its operating margins for 1997 may decline from year-ago levels. Shares closed at 134-3/8 but slipped 1-1/4 to 133-1/8 in after-hours trading Friday.
* United Technologies Corp announced a two-for-one stock split. Shares closed at 120-1/4.
* Continental Circuits Corp said it agreed to acquire Sigma Circuits Inc, paying 0.7 share for each Sigma share. Continental closed at 12, Sigma closed at 7-1/16.

* HighwayMaster Communications Inc said it will receive a $20 million investment from SBC Communications Inc, raising SBC's stake to about 20 percent. HighwayMaster shares closed at 14-1/2, SBC closed at 47-5/8.
* Harleysville Group Inc said it expects $0.61 per share in hurricane-related reductions to its third quarter earnings. Shares closed at 26-3/8.
* The U.S. Defense Department agreed to full production under a $9.4 billion aircraft contract with Northrop Grumman Corp, the Wall Street Journal reported. Shares closed at 77.
Chrysler Corp and the United Auto Workers reached a tentative agreement in their contract talks. Chrysler shares closed at 28-1/8.
* Dell Computer Corp said third quarter results are "looking strong" but may not match its "astronomical" second quarter performance. Shares closed at 76.
